reviews.text: During a 10 day stay in Amsterdam, I had the pleasure of staying at the Amistad Hotel on Kerkstraat. I have to say that they scored 100% on the 3 "C"s: Clean, Comfortable and Convenient. After getting to know the city a little, I came to realize that the Amistad was truly in the middle of everything a visitor would want. Walking distance to EVERTYING. The building, a beautifully restored "Canal Style" house adds a cozy element not found in major hotel chains, and really adds to the whole "Amsterdam Experience". The included breakfast service was fantastic and it stayed open until 1pm for the days I felt like sleeping in. Additionally, the high-speed internet (available privately in your room or in the internet lounge) was an impressive amenity also included in the price of the room. The team the runs the Amistad is extremely friendly, welcoming, and knowledgeable about where to go, when to go and how to get there. As well as being in the historic center of town, the Amistad is also in the middle of Gay nightlife. I would definitely stay there again and recommend the Amistad highly to anyone considering a trip to Amsterdam. (Important lesson learned: Most if not all of the hotels I researched online SAY that they are in the City Center of Amsterdam, but that is definitely not true. The Amistad is in the center of the old part of the city, which is exactly where a traveler would want to stay).

For a B&B, we received a clean, well-decorated room with more than a touch of elegance. I recommend asking to stay in the B&B which is about a one-minute walk from the hotel (though they only accept cash payment at the B&B). The B&B rooms are historic and rustic -- beautiful. Kerstraat is not busy, but ask for a room in the hotel or B&B's rear to avoid street noise. Breakfast was simple and fine. The guests teneded to stick to themselves, so it's not a social atmosphere if that's what you are after.
reviews.title: A fine experience

reviews.text: My partner and I just stayed in their penthouse apt on Kerkstraat. It was a great experience. The guys at the hotel were great ... always ready to provide advice and help when we needed to know how to get around and what was going on in town. They even invited us to their New Year's eve party. The apt was wonderful ... very modern and with all the conveniences of home. It really felt like we were living in ams ... not just their on vacation. There was a food store and a laundry mat just down the street. The location was great too ... very near the museums and the Leidseplein.

We also heard him doing the same to another party of guests, so not a one-off methinks! Plus he was not the politest person in the world (especially for the Dutch), walking directly into our apartment to complain about the noise (it was about 10pm on a Friday night and honestly, we weren't that bad!)

reviews.text: Arrived at this overpriced little poky place with 3 huge bags and was offered no help up the narrow Alice in Wonderland stairs. Passport got kept on arrival and only returned on check-out. "Minibar" is more of a small fridge with water than anything else. I was told to lock the windows because of theft. Walls are thin. Bedding is old Bathrooms are shared. Promiscuous guests. Breakfast a joke - self service, you even have to washing your own dishes. I could have rented a flat. Never again! Pathetic attempt of a hotel. You can stay at the Crown Plaza for the same price.
